title: Star Wars Hunters Tier List
description: Dive into the arena and learn which characters reign supreme in our Star Wars Hunters tier list. We break down the top contenders from S to C tier, ranking them based on their abilities, strengths, and overall effectiveness in combat. Whether you're a seasoned veteran or a new recruit, this guide will help you choose the right Hunters to dominate your opponents and claim victory.
heading: Star Wars Hunters Tier List
introText: Dive into the arena and learn which characters reign supreme in our Star Wars Hunters tier list. We break down the top contenders from S to C tier, ranking them based on their abilities, strengths, and overall effectiveness in combat. Whether you're a seasoned veteran or a new recruit, this guide will help you choose the right Hunters to dominate your opponents and claim victory.

data.itemDescription: Rieve is a melee powerhouse with incredible damage output and mobility
Sprocket is a must-have support character with excellent healing and buffing abilities
Zaina is a versatile support character with a variety of healing and damage-dealing abilities
Grozz is a tanky Wookiee with great crowd control abilities
Slingshot is a unique tank character who rolls around in a droid, offering protection and disruption
Zaalbar is a durable Imperial heavy gunner with strong offensive and defensive skills
Jango Fett is a versatile ranged character with good damage output and utility
Visas Marr is a Force-wielding character with a mix of offensive and defensive abilities
Greef Karga is a support character who can heal and buff allies, but he is not as effective as Sprocket or Zaina
IG-88 is a ranged character with a focus on area damage, but he is outclassed by other ranged characters
Bossk is a bounty hunter with a mix of ranged and melee abilities, but he is not as well-rounded as other characters
Den is a support character who can heal and revive allies, but he is not as effective as Sprocket or Zaina
